BREAKING CHANGES
For a smooth upgrade, make sure to update to the latest Probot v10 version first (module), run your tests, and address all deprecation messages. Nearly all removed APIs have previously been deprecated.

deprecated module have been removed via link
module property removed. Build your own server instead using module
module is now asynchronous and no longer returns the instance
link is no longer used.
module constructor parameter no longer supported in module. Pass a module instance instead: module
module has been removed. Use module instead
module no longer accepts module to be a path string. Pass the actual function instead.
module removed. Use the new module class instead:

```js
  const { Server, Probot } = require("probot")
  const server = new Server({
    // optional:
    host,
    port,
    webhookPath,
    webhookProxy,
    Probot: Probot.defaults({ id, privateKey, ... })
  })
// load probot app function
  await server.load((app) => {})
// start listening to requests
  await server.start()
  // stop server with: await server.stop()
  ```
If you have more than one app function, combine them in a function instead
```js
  const app1 = require("./app1")
  const app2 = require("./app2")
module.exports = function app ({ probot, getRouter }) {
    await app1({ probot, getRouter })
    await app2({ probot, getRouter })
  }
  ```

module / module removed. Use the new module class instead:

```js
  const { Server, Probot } = require("probot")
  const server = new Server({
    Probot: Probot.defaults({ id, privateKey, ... })
    // optional:
    host,
    port,
    webhookPath,
    webhookProxy,
  })
// load probot app function
  await server.load((app) => {})
// start listening to requests
  await server.start()
  // stop server with: await server.stop()
  ```

module is ignored when using module constructor. Use module instead
module constructor no longer reads environment variables. Pass options instead, or module instead
module has been removed. Use module instead
module has been removed. Use module instead
module has been removed. Use module instead
module has been removed. Use the module argument from the app function instead: module
module has been removed. Use module from the app function instead: module
module has been removed. Use module instead
module has been removed. Use module instead
module has been removed. Use module instead
module has been removed. Use module instead
module no longer supports any keys besides module, module, or module
module has been removed. Set module to module instead
module has been removed. Use module instead, the APIs are the same

BREAKING CHANGES

module  is now module

see https://github.com/probot/probot/pull/1441 and discussion at https://github.com/probot/probot/issues/1286#issuecomment-744094299

Breaking changes

module has been updated from v16 to v17. See link. Important: If you currently mocked module methods in your test, replace these with http mocks using nock instead, otherwise your tests will create methods that no longer exist and you will see errors in production although your tests passed. See https://github.com/wip/app/pull/238 for an example
URL parameters are now always encoded when using module methods. For example, if you use module make sure to not encode the value for module. Also if you were mocking http requests in your tests, replace e.g. module with module
require Node 10.21+
Logging: an object with extra information must be passed as first argument. Passing it as last argument is no longer supported.

before
module
after
module

The logging output changed. Before, probot used link with all kind of hacks and customizations for its log output. Now we use link. We still do the formatting and sending errors to Sentry in the same process, but the logic is now encapsulated in link. We might decouple it in future as part of making Probot more suitable for serverless/function environments
module now returns module instead of module. Use module for module method calls.
module event was renamed to module
The module package no longer exports module. Use module instead.

module
- module no longer accepts module. In order to disable throttling for testing, set module to module:
```js
  const { Probot, ProbotOctokit } = require('probot')
const probot = new Probot({
    Octokit: ProbotOctokit.defaults({ retry: { enabled: false }, throttle: { enabled: false } })
  })
  moduleprobot.errorHandlermoduleprobot.httpServermoduleapp.log.targetmoduleroutermoduleApplicationmodulenew Application({ router })`

Breaking changes

‚ö†Ô∏è all link have been removed. Make sure you address all deprecation messages you see with Probot v7 before upgrading.
module: Changes in errors thrown due to GraphQL errors
module is now module, was module
module is now module
preview headers that are not required to use an API are no longer set automatically. Set using module
module has been removed. Use module instead
Methods for undocumented endpoints have been removed.
Instead of module use module
Instead of module use module
module methods have been removed. Use your own link instance and install the link
module sends module parameter with "module" namespace instead of sending the array in the request body root. This is not supported by GitHub Enterprise 2.15 or older. You have several options.
Use the link
Use the link loading all routes for the GHE version you want to support

Use module directly:
module
* The module parameter is no longer validated using a regex as it cannot be derived from link
* module is now the response status code number. The status text is no longer returned
* Deprecated module property is no longer supported. Use module instead
* Deprecated module has been removed
* module hase been removed, use module instead


Features

Pagination: the link is now used
.paginate(options, mapFn) now accepts the request options, just like module.
.paginate.iterator(options) allows for async iteration.
Custom requests using link.
Improved Typescript definitions for module
add constructor option for redis config (link) (link), closes link
Add overloads for all Webhook events (link) (link)
Cluster support for request throttling (link)
moar Typescript foo (link)
new github.paginate API, github.paginate.iterator() (link)
new throttling & automated retries (link)
options.Octokit to pass custom Octokit version (link) (link)
standalone run command (link) (link)

Enhancements


Do you love Probot and GraphQL? Well good news for you! Now you can use them together! Be warned: this is experimental. See the link and link. (#472)


An error will now be raised if there are several module files in your app directory. Set module to specify which one you want to use. (#441)


Updated Node.js minimum version required to 8.3.0. This was a requirement for apps to run before, but the check was only looking for 7.7. (#464)


Switched from link to link. You shouldn't notice any changes, but let us know if your app has any weird symptoms (#462)


Updated @octokit/rest to version 15.2.0


link

Breaking Changes

Migrate to @octokit/rest.js, which is the latest version of the module client. There shouldn't be any noticeable changes, but since module is a complete rewrite of the module internals, we're marking this a breaking change just to be safe. (#400)

Improvements


Allow setting module on logger components. (#355)
module


Community


Need persistence in your app? We've got link to help you out! (#242)


Looking to contribute to Probot? We've started labeling issues module, so link.


link

Breaking Changes


The new webhook proxy link is now the default (#391). Support for link has been removed and will no longer work in development. To update your existing Probot app to use the new webhook proxy in development:


Go to link and click Start a new channel. Set module in your module to the URL that you are redirected to.

Update your GitHub App to deliver webhooks to the webhook proxy URL.
Run module to install the new client
Run module to remove the old client
Run module and your app should work just like it did before! üéâ 

See the link for more information. If you still want to use link, you can install it manually and run module.
Enhancements

Properly handle async errors in express. (#384)
Add module option to disable the module endpoint that is available by default. For popular apps, this endpoint can be expensive to generate. (#392)

Extensions

Check out the link  for sharing configs between between repositories from the team at link. (#390)

link

Improvements

Add early termination to paginate method (#329). Check out the link for more information.

Improvements


GitHub Enterprise Support (#331). See the docs on using link to get started.


Lots of logging improvements (#320), including adding module for logging in your event handlers (#321), module for logging in HTTP requests (#322), and improved logging of GitHub API requests (#351). See the link for more information.


Add support for a new and experimental webhook proxy (#359). Go to https://smee.io and click Start a new channel. Use that URL as your Webhook URL in your GitHub App, and set module to that URL in your module (along with module). This new webhook proxy service will likely replace localtunnel in 5.0.


Update the node-github client to version 12.0.3 (#340)


Breaking Changes


The default log level is now module for module. Set module or module in your module to see more verbose logging from Probot internals.


Probot now uses link internally instead of link (#325). If you are using module and depending on probot for the ejs setup, you'll now need to pull in ejs yourself.
